item.title: Waymo gets green light for airport service in San Francisco
item.description: Waymo is now permitted to test its robotaxi service at San Francisco International Airport (SFO), a big win for the company as it seeks to expand its service area and tackle more popular, revenue-gene

item.title: Why do Waymos keep loitering in front of my house?
item.description: When a Waymo pulls up and parks in front of her home on a residential street in West Los Angeles, 10-year-old Morgan rushes to the window. “The Waymo is home!” she says, calling to her parents, Lisa D

item.title: Uber’s Drive to Become the Kleenex of Robotaxis
item.description: It doesn’t matter who makes the tech—when you call a robocar, Uber’s mission now is to make sure you use its app.

item.title: Waymo responds to Tesla’s dick joke with a bigger Austin robotaxi map
item.description: Earlier this week, Elon Musk posted an image of Tesla’s robotaxi service area in Austin, Texas, that was in the shape of a penis. Hilarious, I know, but more importantly: it appeared that Tesla’s map
